ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Leaks in CVS HEAD?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah.  We ve seen this on occasion.  Odd is how the exception message is null in the above.  I assume you have plenty disk and none of the other logs are

Tom Emerson wrote:

> Running a domain-scope crawl (62 seeds) using BDB frontier I'm running
> out of memory about 48% of the way through. Various vitals:
>
> Dual CPU P3, 1G physical memory, running Gentoo 2.6.8-gentoo-r3 kernel.
> Java 1.5.0-b64.
> Heritrix 1.3 HEAD, built on 7 Febuary around 11AM EST.
>
> The log is full of warning messages like:
>
> 02/12/2005 09:19:55 +0000 WARNING 
> org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorHTML innerProcess Failed get of 
> replay char sequence 
> CrawlURI(http://mosabeghelaliga.persianblog.com/1383_3_mosabeghelaliga_archive.html) 
> <http://mosabeghelaliga.persianblog.com/1383_3_mosabeghelaliga_archive.html%29> 
> null ToeThread #22
>
Yeah.  We've seen this on occasion.  Odd is how the exception message is 
'null' in the above.  I assume you have plenty disk and none of the 
other logs are throwing IOExceptions anywhere?

> This may not be problematic --- though I've not seen these before on 
> other crawls.
>
> Then I see blocks like:
>
> glyphCount=0 flags=10001
> glyphCount=0 flags=10000
> glyphCount=0 flags=10000
> glyphCount=60 flags=10010001
> glyphCount=42 flags=10010001
> glyphCount=0 flags=10001
> glyphCount=75 flags=10010000
> glyphCount=0 flags=10001
> glyphCount=0 flags=10000
> glyphCount=0 flags=10001
> glyphCount=0 flags=10000
> glyphCount=0 flags=10000
> glyphCount=14 flags=10001
> glyphCount=6 flags=10001
>
These are System.out prints from the ExtractorSWF.  Need to make a build 
that turns these emissions off.

On the OOMEs, I do not have ideas.  With so few seeds, you shouldn't be 
seeing OOMEs.  Whats your frontier report say about queues, etc.?  
Anything exotic about your order file -- other than the locations you're 
visiting?

Since you're running 1.5.0 JVM, you might send over the output from running

% $JAVA_HOME/bin/jmap -histo PID

This does a dump of heap instances and sizes.

Might give a clue as to whats sticking in the heap.

St.Ack

> Then I see
>
> <<<
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
>      #12   [no CrawlURI]
>         WAITING for 14s492ms
>         Where: ABOUT_TO_GET_URI for 14494ms
>
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
> >>>
> <<<
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
>      #27   
> http://ngdir.ir/MagneticLineament/MagneticLineament.asp?Cmd=MAP (0 
> attempts)
>         LLL
>         Current processor: Postselector
>         WAITING for 1m16s218ms
>         Where: ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR for 75920ms
>
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
> >>>
> <<<
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
>      #36   
> http://shamlou.org/index.php?option=com_pms&Itemid=34&page=new&id=405 
> <http://shamlou.org/index.php?option=com_pms&Itemid=34&page=new&id=405> 
> (0 attempts)
>         XLLXLLLLL
>         Current processor: Postselector
>         ACTIVE for 22s381ms
>         Where: ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR for 15475ms
>
> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
> >>>
>
> and so on.
>
> Let me know what else I can supply.
